Class Location2

  • java.lang.Object
    • Location2
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    InsideLocation, OutsideLocation

    public abstract class Location2
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class for the location. Each location has a HashMap of its exits and of its views, as well as an ArrayList of all the objects in the location.
    Version:
    1
    Author:
    Edward Stevinson

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Location2(java.lang.String locationName)
      Create a room described "locationName".

        view - The image of the view in that direction.

      • getLocationName

        public java.lang.String getLocationName()
        Return the name of the location.
        Returns:
        The short description of the location.

      • getExit

        public Location2 getExit(java.lang.String direction)
        Return the room that is reached if we go from this room in direction "direction". If there is no room in that direction, return null.
        Parameters:
        direction - The exit's direction.
        Returns:
        The room in the given direction.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the direction is invalid.

      • getView

        public javafx.scene.image.Image getView(java.lang.String direction)
        Return the image of the direction being faced. If no image is available display a 'Image Not Available' picture.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction which we want the view from.
        Returns:
        Image The image associated with that view.

      • keyInUseInViews

        public boolean keyInUseInViews(java.lang.String key)
        Method to return whether a specific String is currently a key in the views HashMap.
        Parameters:
        key - The String to check if it is a key.
        Returns:
        True if key is in the views HashMap
